name: God (YHWH)
blurb: God—the covenant name often rendered YHWH—is the Creator and Lord of history. Genesis portrays God as personal (speaking, blessing, judging), sovereign over chaos, and faithful to His promises. He for
searchText: god (yhwh) divine narrative god—the covenant name often rendered yhwh—is the creator and lord of history. genesis portrays god as personal (speaking, blessing, judging), sovereign over chaos, and faithful to his promises. he forms humanity in his image (gen 1:26–27), enters into relationship with them, and, after the fall, pursues them with mercy. jewish tradition emphasizes god’s covenantal chesed (steadfast love) and justice; christian theology sees in genesis the roots of redemption that culminate in christ. from eden to babel, god’s actions frame the story: creation, judgment (flood, dispersion), and gracious election. d.god-yhwh--34eab3d9

name: Noah
blurb: Noah ‘walked with God’ in a corrupt generation. Obedient to God’s word, he builds the ark and becomes the instrument of preservation through the Flood. Afterward, God covenants never again to destroy
searchText: noah person narrative noah ‘walked with god’ in a corrupt generation. obedient to god’s word, he builds the ark and becomes the instrument of preservation through the flood. afterward, god covenants never again to destroy the earth with water, giving the rainbow as a sign. jewish tradition debates whether noah’s righteousness was relative or absolute; christian readers see in him a type of christ—obedient, saving his household. p.noah.daughter-of-zelophehad--9d853482

name: Cain
blurb: Firstborn of Adam and Eve, Cain embodies sin’s spread beyond Eden. Jealous of Abel, he murders his brother despite God’s warning to master sin. Banished yet marked, he fathers a city and a culture—mus
searchText: cain person narrative firstborn of adam and eve, cain embodies sin’s spread beyond eden. jealous of abel, he murders his brother despite god’s warning to master sin. banished yet marked, he fathers a city and a culture—music, metallurgy, livestock—showing creativity estranged from god.

name: Isaac
blurb: The son of promise, Isaac embodies God’s fidelity to His word. Spared on Moriah (Gen 22), he receives Abraham’s covenant and becomes father to Esau and Jacob. Isaac’s narrative is quieter yet pivotal,
searchText: isaac person narrative the son of promise, isaac embodies god’s fidelity to his word. spared on moriah (gen 22), he receives abraham’s covenant and becomes father to esau and jacob. isaac’s narrative is quieter yet pivotal, showing god’s promise advancing through ordinary life and tested faith. p.isaac--3af10add p.isaac.gene-26--da8ff3bc

name: Magicians of Egypt
blurb: Royal sages unable to interpret Pharaoh’s dreams; their inability spotlights Joseph’s God-given insight.
searchText: magicians of egypt group narrative royal sages unable to interpret pharaoh’s dreams; their inability spotlights joseph’s god-given insight.

name: Abel
blurb: Abel offers the firstborn of his flock and is regarded by God. Murdered by Cain, he becomes Scripture’s first martyr. His blood cries for justice, while Christ’s blood speaks a better word of mercy.
searchText: abel person narrative abel offers the firstborn of his flock and is regarded by god. murdered by cain, he becomes scripture’s first martyr. his blood cries for justice, while christ’s blood speaks a better word of mercy.

name: Adam
blurb: Adam, formed from dust and enlivened by God’s breath, embodies humanity’s vocation: to image God, cultivate creation, and live by God’s word (Gen 2:7–17). His failure in Eden fractures fellowship with
searchText: adam person narrative adam, formed from dust and enlivened by god’s breath, embodies humanity’s vocation: to image god, cultivate creation, and live by god’s word (gen 2:7–17). his failure in eden fractures fellowship with god and distorts human relationships. jewish tradition remembers adam as both glorious and tragic; christian theology contrasts adam with christ—the ‘last adam’ who obeys where adam failed. adam’s story explains the human condition and sets the pattern for exile and the hope of return.

name: Carmi
blurb: Son of Reuben listed among those who went to Egypt.
searchText: carmi person genealogy son of reuben listed among those who went to egypt.

name: Eve
blurb: Eve, ‘mother of all living’ (Gen 3:20), is created as Adam’s counterpart and partner in the divine mission. Deceived by the serpent, she eats and gives to Adam; yet she becomes the bearer of the promi
searchText: eve person narrative eve, ‘mother of all living’ (gen 3:20), is created as adam’s counterpart and partner in the divine mission. deceived by the serpent, she eats and gives to adam; yet she becomes the bearer of the promise that her seed will crush evil (gen 3:15). jewish midrash explores her complexity; christian tradition pairs eve with mary as a reversal motif: where eve believed the serpent, mary believed god.

name: Gershon

searchText: builders of babel group narrative a unified people who seek a great name and security against dispersion by building a city and a tower. god confuses their language, scattering them. jewish tradition reads babel as prideful centralization; christians often see a contrast with pentecost.
